Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements an embedded HTTP server using Netty framework, capable of handling HTTP requests and routing them to appropriate controller methods based on URI paths.

Class Description: EmbedHttpServer is a Netty-based HTTP server implementation that provides request routing functionality to various controller methods. It supports adding custom controllers with RequestMapping annotations and handles both successful responses and error cases.

Attributes:
- port: int - The port number on which the server will listen
- defaultController: DefaultController - The default controller to handle unmatched requests
- controllerList: List<Object> - List of registered controller objects that handle specific routes
- LOGGER: Logger - Logger instance for error and debug logging

Methods:
- EmbedHttpServer(int port) -> EmbedHttpServer - Constructor that initializes the server with specified port
- invoke(String uri, Channel channel, FullHttpRequest request) -> FullHttpResponse - Routes the incoming request to the appropriate controller method based on URI matching
- fixUri(String uri) -> String - Normalizes URI paths by ensuring proper slash formatting
- start(GenericFutureListener startedListener) -> void - Starts the Netty server with specified configuration and event listeners
- addController(Object obj) -> EmbedHttpServer - Registers a controller object to handle specific routes, supports method chaining
